context_evidences: - CDC and FDA will continue to monitor for and evaluate reports of GBS occurring after COVID-19 vaccination and will share more information as it becomes available. Reference: https://www.cdc.gov/coronavirus/2019-ncov/vaccines/safety/adverse-events.html published on 2020-02-11 00:00:00

- Cardiac complications, particularly myocarditis and pericarditis, have been associated with SARS-CoV-2 (the virus that causes COVID-19) infection ( 1 – 3 ) and mRNA COVID-19 vaccination ( 2 – 5 ). Reference: https://www.cdc.gov/mmwr/volumes/71/wr/mm7114e1.htm published on 2022-04-01 00:00:00

- The combination between vaccine types (“CoronaVac”, “Comirnaty”, “BNT162b2”) and outcome of interests (“Thromboembolism”, “Thromboembolic”, “thrombosis”, “embolism”, “Hemorrhagic stroke”) were used as search terms in both PubMed and Embase on April 1, 2022, for all English articles without date restrictions. Nineteen analytical studies were found but there were inconsistent conclusions for BNT162b2 as two studies suggested a potentially increased risk of thromboembolic events after vaccination, one study suggested an increased risk of hemorrhagic stroke and the remainder reported no association between BNT162b2 and these outcomes. No published articles were found reporting significant risk of thromboembolic events nor hemorrhagic stroke after CoronaVac vaccination, and limited published articles explored the safety effects after both first and second doses. Reference: https://www.thelancet.com/journals/eclinm/article/PIIS2589-5370(22)00234-6/fulltext published on 2022-08-02 00:00:00

- A safety monitoring system flagged that U.S. drugmaker Pfizer Inc (PFE.N) and German partner BioNTech's updated COVID-19 shot could be linked to a type of brain stroke in older adults, according to preliminary data analyzed by U.S. health authorities. Reference: https://www.reuters.com/business/healthcare-pharmaceuticals/us-says-pfizers-bivalent-covid-shot-may-be-linked-stroke-older-adults-2023-01-13/ published on 2023-01-13 21:26:34

- This is the first population-based study on the safety effect of thromboembolic events and hemorrhagic stroke after both doses of BNT162b2 and CoronaVac among the Chinese population. The modified self-control case series study showed an increased risk of hemorrhagic stroke after both first and second doses of BNT162b2 but not after CoronaVac. No increased risk was observed for thromboembolic events for both vaccines; whilst the incidences among those vaccinated are lower than that in SARS-CoV-2 test positive cases. Reference: https://www.thelancet.com/journals/eclinm/article/PIIS2589-5370(22)00234-6/fulltext published on 2022-08-02 00:00:00

- "Although the totality of the data currently suggests that it is very unlikely that the signal in VSD (Vaccine Safety Datalink) represents a true clinical risk, we believe it is important to share this information with the public," the health authorities said. Reference: https://www.reuters.com/business/healthcare-pharmaceuticals/us-says-pfizers-bivalent-covid-shot-may-be-linked-stroke-older-adults-2023-01-13/ published on 2023-01-13 21:26:34

- GBS is a rare disorder in which the body’s immune system damages nerve cells, causing muscle weakness and sometimes paralysis. GBS has largely been observed among people ages 50 years and older. Reference: https://www.cdc.gov/coronavirus/2019-ncov/vaccines/safety/adverse-events.html published on 2020-02-11 00:00:00

- The incidence of cardiac outcomes after mRNA COVID-19 vaccination was highest for males aged 12–17 years after the second vaccine dose; however, within this demographic group, the risk for cardiac outcomes was 1.8–5.6 times as high after SARS-CoV-2 infection than after the second vaccine dose. Reference: https://www.cdc.gov/mmwr/volumes/71/wr/mm7114e1.htm published on 2022-04-01 00:00:00
correction_response:
This tweet is somewhat misleading. While a safety monitoring system flagged a potential link between Pfizer's COVID-19 vaccine and a type of brain stroke in older adults, it's important to note that this is based on preliminary data and requires further investigation. Pfizer, BioNTech, the CDC, and the FDA have not observed similar findings in other monitoring systems, both in the U.S. and globally. The incidence of stroke following vaccination is also lower than that among SARS-CoV-2 test positive cases, making vaccination an important public health intervention. 
https://www.reuters.com/business/healthcare-pharmaceuticals/us-says-pfizers-bivalent-covid-shot-may-be-linked-stroke-older-adults-2023-01-13/
https://www.thelancet.com/journals/eclinm/article/PIIS2589-5370(22)00234-6/fulltext
note_1_text: For further context- “a CDC vaccine database had uncovered a possible safety issue in which people 65 and older were more likely to have an ischemic stroke 21 days after receiving the Pfizer/BioNTech bivalent shot, compared with days 22-44.”    https://www.reuters.com/business/healthcare-pharmaceuticals/us-says-pfizers-bivalent-covid-shot-may-be-linked-stroke-older-adults-2023-01-13/
note_2_text: It's precautionary.    "Neither Pfizer & BioNTech nor the CDC or FDA have observed similar findings across other monitoring systems in the US & globally & there is no evidence to conclude that ischemic stroke is associated w/ the use of (sic) COVID vaccines" the companies added.    https://www.reuters.com/business/healthcare-pharmaceuticals/us-says-pfizers-bivalent-covid-shot-may-be-linked-stroke-older-adults-2023-01-13/
queries:
1. CDC investigation on Pfizer Covid Vaccine and stroke link
2. Recent studies on Pfizer Covid Vaccine causing strokes
3. News about Pfizer Covid Vaccine side effects in 2023
refute_evidences: - We detected a possible safety signal for hemorrhagic stroke following BNT162b2 vaccination. The incidence of thromboembolic event or hemorrhagic stroke following vaccination is lower than that among SARS-CoV-2 test positive cases; therefore, vaccination against covid-19 remains an important public health intervention. Reference: https://www.thelancet.com/journals/eclinm/article/PIIS2589-5370(22)00234-6/fulltext published on 2022-08-02 00:00:00

- "Neither Pfizer and BioNTech nor the CDC or FDA have observed similar findings across numerous other monitoring systems in the U.S. and globally and there is no evidence to conclude that ischemic stroke is associated with the use of the companies' COVID-19 vaccines," the companies added. Reference: https://www.reuters.com/business/healthcare-pharmaceuticals/us-says-pfizers-bivalent-covid-shot-may-be-linked-stroke-older-adults-2023-01-13/ published on 2023-01-13 21:26:34

- The analysis found no increased risk of GBS after Pfizer-BioNTech or Moderna vaccination. Reference: https://www.cdc.gov/coronavirus/2019-ncov/vaccines/safety/adverse-events.html published on 2020-02-11 00:00:00

- The FDA and CDC said that other large studies, the CDC's Vaccine Adverse Event Reporting System, other countries' databases and Pfizer-BioNTech's databases had not flagged this safety issue, adding that it requires more investigation. Reference: https://www.reuters.com/business/healthcare-pharmaceuticals/us-says-pfizers-bivalent-covid-shot-may-be-linked-stroke-older-adults-2023-01-13/ published on 2023-01-13 21:26:34

- An increased risk of hemorrhagic stroke was detected after BNT162b2 among a Chinese population. However, the incidence of thromboembolic events and hemorrhagic stroke after vaccination is lower than that among SARS-CoV-2 test positive cases. Hence, vaccination against covid-19 remains an important public health intervention. Reference: https://www.thelancet.com/journals/eclinm/article/PIIS2589-5370(22)00234-6/fulltext published on 2022-08-02 00:00:00

- CDC found higher than expected rates of GBS reported to VAERS after J&J/Janssen COVID-19 vaccination but not after mRNA COVID-19 vaccination. Reference: https://www.cdc.gov/coronavirus/2019-ncov/vaccines/safety/adverse-events.html published on 2020-02-11 00:00:00
tweet_text: BREAKING: The CDC is now investigating a possible link between Pfizer Covid Vaccines and strokes
